result.execSummary:
The defendant John C. Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender - Fail/Update Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John C. Nelson in court with attorney Brent W. Varner.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives recommendation.   Plea to Count 1.    No contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Court imposes sentence.
Count 1:
$268.00 fine or costs, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
$250.00 surcharge, DNA sample already provided.  
6 months in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive.  Jail to commence on or before Oct 9, 2014 at 7 p.m.
Paperwork handed in court.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 11, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Return date on August 5, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Brent W. Varner in court.  John A. Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Varner requests reset as DE didn't have transportation for today.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant but stays it until 8/5/2014.  Return date scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on July 28, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant John C. Nelson appeared by video means with Attorney Woodard. Prosecuting Atty Sue M. Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Defendant does qualify.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State request $1000.00 cash bond.  Attorney Woodard gives status and request signature bond.  Release from Sauk Co. jail is March 8, 2014.   Time limits waived.  $2000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Comply with sex offender registration requirements promptly, advise clerk of court of current address upon release and no further law violations.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
